cleanDesc: ECS Tuning Aluminum Coolant Bleeder Screw
short-description: Replace the flimsy plastic bleeder screw used in the coolant expansion tank or in one of the cooling system hoses with this high quality, durable, aluminum bleeder screw. The stock plastic screw can deform over time due to heat or even regular use. We have even seen the head of the screw snap off, leaving the threaded body stuck in the expansion tank. This aluminum screw will help to prevent sudden failure of the bleeder screw, which can result in immediate overheating of the car.

cleanDesc: E36 Mishimoto Aluminum Coolant Reservoir Tank
short-description: If you have ever experienced a leaking plastic BMW expansion tank you will realize the value of this aluminum version straight away. Even if a failure has not happened to you, it's easy to tell this tank is much stronger and more durable than the plastic used in the stock design. Mishimoto has extended their cooling system expertise from aluminum radiators to expansion tank design. The original BMW plastic tanks suffer from leaks and failures with no warning. While being light weight and recyclable the design and construction of the stock tank is just not up for reliable long term use. Mishimoto has designed their tank with an integrated dipstick/bleeder and a 1.3bar cap that raises the boiling point of the system (the stock radiator cap is not compatible).

cleanDesc: Genuine BMW Coolant/Washer Level Sensor (installs in expansion tank)...
short-description: This is the sensor / sending unit that notifies the computer if your coolant level is low. When this fails, it can give a false indication of low coolant -- or worse, not inform you of a low coolant situation which could potential cause overheating. (Note: This sensor is also found in the windshield washer container, to alert the computer when you are low on washer fluid)

cleanDesc: Blackline Performance Chargecooler Coolant Tank Cap Cover - Red - BM...

Each cap is CNC formed from T6 Aluminum and anodized in a limited release race inspired red color. All logos and decorations are finalized through a precision 3D milling process, machined into each cap for the ultimate premium finish. cleanDesc: Genuine BMW Coolant Expansion Tank - E46 M3
short-description: This radiator coolant reservoir/expansion tank for E46 M3 is a common failure item as the plastic weakens over time and stress crack will lead to coolant leaks. If your car has over 80k miles and hasn't had one of these replaced, we highly recommend it during your next major service. We have found that the aftermarket coolant reservoirs fail easier than the original BMW piece so we only offer the BMW type on this part.   When doing any sort of repair or maintenance there is no replacement for genuine factory parts. Turner Motorsport carries the Genuine BMW brand with pride and has the parts you need to complete your next project with confidence.     2001-2006    M3

cleanDesc: Mahle-Behr Coolant Expansion Tank - E46, E53, E83
short-description: This coolant reservoir is for the non-M E46 3-series models from 1999-2006 (M3 takes a different expansion tank). We have found that the expansion tanks should be replaced based on age as well as condition. Expansion tanks seem to have a lifespan of less than six years before they show signs of fatigue and wear. Pre-emptively replacing the expansion tank as part of an overall maintenance plan can prevent you from getting stranded from a sudden failure later on. This is the most recent expansion tank design from Hella-Behr, the OEM supplier to BMW. It replaces the original BMW part number 17137787039.   Other items to consider replacing at the same time are the radiator cap, coolant level sensor, lower radiator hose, coolant temp sensor in the lower hose, and the hose clamps. If your car has an automatic transmission you should also replace the oil cooler thermostat in the radiator frame, which is a common source for leaks.      1999-2006    - 323i, 323Ci, 325i, 325Ci, 325xi, 328i, 328Ci, 330i, 330Ci & 330xi (**no M)  2004-2008    - X3 2.5, X3 3.0, X3 3.0si  2000-2005    - X5 3.0

cleanDesc: Coolant Expansion Tank
short-description: The coolant expansion tank in your vehicle gives additional fluid a place to go after expansion and contraction from temperature change. Because it is subjected to such drastic changes on a regular basis, it can often crack or break. You want to keep all the coolant in your vehicle in the cooling system. If your tank has experienced damage such as cracking, nipples breaking off, or mounting point damage, you will need to replace it.

cleanDesc: Coolant Expansion Tank - E46 (non-M), X3, X5 3.0
short-description: This coolant reservoir is for the non-M E46 3-series models from 1999-2006 (M3 takes a different expansion tank). We have found that the expansion tanks should be replaced based on age as well as condition. Expansion tanks seem to have a lifespan of less than six years before they show signs of fatigue and wear. Pre-emptively replacing the expansion tank as part of an overall maintenance plan can prevent you from getting stranded from a sudden failure later on. This is the most recent expansion tank design from Hella-Behr, the OEM supplier to BMW. It replaces the original BMW part number 17137787039.   Other items to consider replacing at the same time are the radiator cap, coolant level sensor, lower radiator hose, coolant temp sensor in the lower hose, and the hose clamps. If your car has an automatic transmission you should also replace the oil cooler thermostat in the radiator frame, which is a common source for leaks.      1999-2006    - 323i, 323Ci, 325i, 325Ci, 325xi, 328i, 328Ci, 330i, 330Ci & 330xi (**no M)  2004-2008    - X3 2.5, X3 3.0, X3 3.0si  2000-2005    - X5 3.0

cleanDesc: Expansion Tank
short-description: The coolant expansion tank in your vehicle gives additional fluid a place to go after expansion and contraction from temperature change. Because it is subjected to such drastic changes on a regular basis, it can often crack or break. You want to keep all the coolant in your vehicle in the cooling system. If your tank has experienced damage such as cracking, nipples breaking off, or mounting point damage, you will need to replace it.

cleanDesc: Turner Motorsport Aluminum Coolant Expansion Tank Relocation Kit - E...
short-description: Hotside intakes are a very common modification for N54 powered BMWs. Here at Turner Motorsport, we found ourselves unsatisfied with all existing solutions to relocate the coolant expansion tank to the cold side of your engine bay, freeing up real estate on the hot side. We decided to make an end all be all solution for people looking to relocate your expansion tank that's compatible with both hotside intakes and factory location coldside intakes. All CAD designed in-house, our N54 aluminum expansion tank relocation kit allows you to seamlessly mount our new aluminum expansion tank on the cold side of your engine bay.

cleanDesc: Turner Motorsport Aluminum Coolant Expansion Tank Relocation Kit - E...
short-description: Hotside intakes are a very common modification for N54 powered BMWs. Here at Turner Motorsport, we found ourselves unsatisfied with all existing solutions to relocate the coolant expansion tank to the cold side of your engine bay, freeing up real estate on the hot side. We decided to make an end all be all solution for people looking to relocate your expansion tank. All CAD designed in-house, our N54 aluminum expansion tank relocation kit allows you to seamlessly mount our new aluminum expansion tank on the cold side of your engine bay, featuring an integrated power steering pump reservoir mount. During the design process, we did everything possible to ensure no air pockets could develop in the cooling system even during spirited drives. The baffled tank is all TIG welded 5052 aluminum construction, featuring a carefully designed bleed passage. We also machined all of our bungs to accept OEM hose ends, to keep the fit and finish as OE+ as possible. Keeping with this same mindset, we made sure that coolant elevation matches OE exactly, and integrated a power steering pump reservoir mount. Our aluminum expansion tank accepts the OE coolant level sensor, bleeder screw, and coolant cap, but we include new ones with this kit, as we thought you should replace them during installation. See more about these features in the list below, and if you have any additional questions please feel free to call into our staff of skilled BMW enthusiasts at 1-800-280-6966. Find our Installation Guide HERE Features and benefits: TIG welded 5052 aluminum construction, wrinkle black powder coated Utilizes factory coolant capacity and expansion volume CAD designed to retain OE coolant elevation, which prevents air pockets Baffled tank ensures that air pockets will not be created under spirited driving conditions, and ensures accurate coolant level reading Meticulously designed bleed passage prevents air pockets while the engine cools All bungs machined for factory hose end compatibility (no barb fittings!) Integrated power steering reservoir mount Kit includes Turner Motorsport aluminum expansion tank, Turner Motorsport wiring harness, all necessary hoses, hardware, OE level sensor, bleeder screw, and coolant cap This product fits the following BMWs: 2008-2013 E82 135i 2007-2013 E88 135i

cleanDesc: Expansion Tank Cap
short-description: The coolant expansion tank cap keeps necessary pressure on your coolant to increase efficiency. If you have an overheating issue in your vehicle, a simple, quick, and inexpensive part to replace is this cap.

cleanDesc: Coolant Expansion Tank
short-description: The coolant expansion tank in your vehicle gives additional fluid a place to go after expansion and contraction from temperature change. Because it is subjected to such drastic changes on a regular basis, it can often crack or break. You want to keep all the coolant in your vehicle in the cooling system. If your tank has experienced damage such as cracking, nipples breaking off, or mounting point damage, you will need to replace it.

Genuine MINI Coolant Expansion Tank
OEM Behr Radiator Expansion Tank - MINI Cooper R50 R52
short-description: This high quality BEHR brand expansion tank is used on MINI Cooper R50 R52, and is a common failure item. BEHR was the original equipment supplier to BMW, so you know the BEHR made expansion tank will be the highest quality available. Be cautious of competitors selling this part for less -- is it a BEHR? Probably not. We only carry the BEHR brand expansion tank as it is the only one we use in our own MINIs. If you are overhauling your coolant system, now is the time to consider preventative replacing this expansion tank. These are known to go bad, causing a leak which can leave you stranded. We have found that the expansion tanks should be replaced based on age as well as condition. Expansion tanks seem to have a lifespan of less than six years before they show signs of fatigue and wear. Pre-emptively replacing the expansion tank as part of an overall maintenance plan can prevent you from getting stranded from a sudden failure later on.   Hailing from Stuttgart, Mahle-Behr specializes in automotive cooling systems. From air conditioning to engine cooling M-B has you covered with OE-quality replacement parts.     2002-2006    MINI Cooper  2005-2008    MINI Cooper Convertible.
